title: Is there option of doing MA after completing BA (Programme) from DU? If yes, then what is the process? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes there is an option of doing M.A. from DU and there are 2 options for the admission procedure:- On the basis of percentage you’ve secured in your UG(any course)On the basis of an entrance test which will completely be based on what you’ve studied in B.A. English (H)The colleges offering M.A. English hons are as follows:- Daulat Ram College(W)  Hans Raj College  Hindu College  Indraprastha College(W)  Kirori Mal College  Janki Devi Memorial College(W)  Miranda House(W)  Ramjas College  Rajdhani College  S.G.T.B. Khalsa College (Day)  St. Stephen’s College  Zakir Hussain College  Atma Ram Sanatan Dharma College  Deshbandhu College  Dyal Singh College  Gargi College (W)  Jesus & Mary College(W)  Lady Shri Ram College (W)  Sri Venkateswara College  Non- Collegiate Women’s Education Board(W) **Hope this helps** :))

yes u can pursue ma ,first complete your ba, after that u will have toaply for ma,,now admission to ma varies from depaartment to department,,some dept gives admission based on ba marks , so takes marks and interview, some take test ,,example for m.sc. electronics 50percent seats are reserved for du students ,,so those who are having highest marks in whole university in electronics gets admitted directly , whereas other 50 seats are filled thorugh entrance which any university student can give..so it depends in which field u want to pursue post grad and what aredepartmental procedure..
